title: Misty conditions expected in several provinces
byline: Showers or thundershowers are likely at a few places in Southern province and in Rathnapura, Monaragala and Kaluthara districts after 2.00 p.m, today (24), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Ex-Inspector wanted over Weligama hotel shooting arrested on return to Sri Lanka
byline: Former Inspector of Police (IP) Jagath Nishantha, who was wanted over the 2023 shooting incident near the W15 Hotel in Weligama and had fled overseas, was arrested yesterday upon returning to Sri Lanka, police said.

title: One dead, three injured in fatal crash at Pannipitiya
byline: One person has been killed and three others injured in a road accident that occurred this morning (24) near a fuel station in the Pannipitiya area along the High Level Road, the Police Media Spokesperson’s Office stated.

title: Expert warns of potential damage to Norochcholai power plant over substandard coal
byline: Energy Analyst Dr. Vidhura Ralapanawe has warned that the use of imported substandard coal at the Lakvijaya Coal Power Plant in Norochcholai could cause significant damage to its power-generating turbines.

title: Suspect arrested with stolen motorcycle with forged number plates in Galle
byline: A suspect has been arrested in the Batapola area of Galle along with a motorcycle fitted with forged number plates that had been concealed inside a house.

title: Two buses collide head-on in Moronthuduwa
byline: Two buses have collided head-on along the Moronthuduwa Road in Wadduwa, police said.

title: Mexico’s most-wanted cartel leader was killed after visit from romantic partner
byline: A visit from a romantic partner of infamous cartel boss Nemesio Oseguera, known as “El Mencho,” led to his capture and death, Mexican authorities said in an assessment of Sunday’s operation, after which 25 members of the National Guard military police were killed in retaliatory violence.

title: Documentary on Sri Lanka’s economic crisis to receive two awards at Indian film festival
byline: The acclaimed Pulitzer Center-supported documentary ‘Democracy in Debt: Sri Lanka Beyond the Headlines’ will receive two awards at the Second Jalgaon International Film Festival in India this year, for ‘Best Social Film’ and ‘Best Screenplay’, reports a press release.

title: Govt. to construct 31,000 houses under 2026 housing programme – Minister
byline: The Minister of Housing Construction and Water Supply, Susil Ranasinghe, announced that plans are underway to construct 31,000 houses this year under the national housing programme.

title: FM Vijitha Herath addresses high-level segment of Conference on Disarmament in Geneva
byline: The high-level segment of the Conference on Disarmament commenced in Geneva yesterday under the presidency of Ambassador Omar Zniber of Morocco and will continue until 25 February 2026.

title: All 7 onboard air ambulance flying to Delhi die in crash in Jharkhand
byline: All seven people on board an air ambulance were killed when the aircraft crashed near Simaria in Jharkhand’s Chatra district on Monday evening. The flight was en route from Ranchi to Delhi when the accident occurred, a top state government official said.

title: Storm paralyzes travel, forcing more than 8,000 US flight disruptions
byline: U.S. airlines are set to add flights on Tuesday, even as they wrestle with thousands of scrubbed flights the day after a powerful Northeast winter storm forced more than 8,000 cancellations and delays.

title: Customs officers launch trade union action over unresolved issues
byline: The Customs Trade Union Alliance has decided to launch trade union action starting today (24), citing several unresolved requests, including promotions, that have been delayed for the past six years.

title: Xbox fans split as AI exec takes over Microsoft’s top gaming role
byline: Xbox fans have been left divided after Microsoft announced Phil Spencer, boss of its gaming division, and Xbox president Sarah Bond would step down from their roles.

title: Human rights are under assault, says UN Secretary General
byline: Human rights are under assault worldwide, the United Nations chief warned on Monday, citing widespread abuses of international law and devastating civilian suffering in conflicts in Sudan, Gaza, and Ukraine.

title: Customs TUs threaten to stage trade union action over unresolved issues
byline: If immediate written and fair solutions are not provided regarding promotions and salaries of customs officers that have been delayed for six years, along with several other issues, they will reluctantly resort to trade union action, the Customs Trade Union Alliance has stated.

title: New York, other US states under state of emergency as snow falls amid blizzard warning
byline: New York, New Jersey, Connecticut and Massachusetts governors issued state of emergency orders and a halt to non-essential travel as a major storm was expected to bring up to 24 inches of snow and strong winds to the region.

title: One dead, another injured in motorcycle–car collision in Kalutara
byline: A motorcyclist has been killed while the pillion rider sustained critical injuries following a collision between a car and a motorcycle in Nagashandiya, Kalutara.

title: Akuregoda Double Murder: 10 arrested, gunman claims underworld figure ordered lawyer’s killing
byline: Police have uncovered a series of new details in the high-profile double murder of a lawyer and his wife, who were shot and killed at a supermarket parking lot in Akuregoda on February 13.

title: 25 Sri Lankan students land in Pakistan for medical studies
byline: Twenty-five Sri Lankan students have landed in Pakistan to study MBBS in top medical universities through the Allama Iqbal Scholarships for Sri Lankan Students.

title: Man dies after wild elephant attack in Panama
byline: An individual has died following a wild elephant attack near the Panama Wewa in Panama, Ampara, police stated.

title: India’s KIIT University confers Kirinde Assaji Thero with Lifetime Achievement Award
byline: Venerable Kirinde Assaji Thero, the Chief Incumbent of Gangaramaya Temple in Hunupitiya, Colombo, has been conferred with the prestigious Lifetime Achievement Award by KIIT University in India.

title: Mirissa and Bentota named among Asia’s best of the best beaches by Tripadvisor
byline: Two Sri Lankan beaches — Mirissa Beach and Bentota Beach — have been ranked among Asia’s leading coastal destinations in the 2026 Travelers’ Choice Awards Best of the Best Beaches list released by Tripadvisor.

title: Sri Lanka apparel exports to UK projected to increase by 10% under new tariff-free scheme
byline: British High Commissioner to Sri Lanka Andrew Patrick and Deputy Minister of Industries and Entrepreneurship Development Chathuranga Abeysinghe have visited apparel logistics and quality assurance facilities north of Colombo to observe shipments being prepared for export to the United Kingdom.

title: Timeframe granted to provide information to PCoI investigating corruption at Colombo MC extended
byline: The timeframe granted for the public to lodge complaints and provide information to the Presidential Commission of Inquiry investigating corruption and fraud at the Colombo Municipal Council has extended until 16 March.

title: ‘Meenagaya’ intercity express train service resumes
byline: The ‘Meenagaya’ intercity express train service, which operates between Colombo Fort and Batticaloa, will resume service from today (23), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: US to stop collecting tariffs deemed illegal by Supreme Court on Tuesday
byline: The U.S. Customs and Border Protection agency said it will halt collections of tariffs imposed under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act at 12:01 a.m. EST (0501 GMT) on Tuesday, more than three days after the U.S. Supreme Court declared the duties illegal.

title: Individual arrested with 2kg of cannabis in Puttalam
byline: An individual has been apprehended with 2kg of cannabis in Puttalam.

title: 2024 Grade 5 Exam paper leak: SC directs AG to file contempt charges against former NIE Director
byline: The Supreme Court of Sri Lanka today (23) directed the Attorney General’s Department to file a charge sheet for Contempt of Court against I.G.S. Premathilaka, the former Director of the National Institute of Education (NIE).

title: 16-year-old arrested for murder of three-wheeler driver and vehicle theft
byline: A suspect has been arrested by the Puttalam Police in connection with the murder of a three-wheeler driver and the theft of his three-wheeler in the Puttalam area.

title: UK government updates passport rules for dual citizens
byline: British and Irish dual nationals may be able to use their expired British passports, along with a valid second passport, to enter the United Kingdom under new temporary measures — but only at the discretion of airlines and other carriers.

title: ‘Red’ landslide warnings lifted for several districts; Public urged to remain cautious - NBRO
byline: The ‘Red’ landslide warnings previously issued for certain districts have now been lifted, scientist at the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO), Dr. Suminda Ratnayake, stated.

title: Ryan Coogler breaks BAFTA record as first Black winner of Best Original Screenplay for ‘Sinners’
byline: Ryan Coogler has made history at the BAFTA Awards with a big win that has added a new feather to his career.

title: Showery conditions over the island to reduce from today
byline: Showery conditions prevailing over the island are expected to reduce from today (23), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Youth arrested with over 500g of ‘Ice’ in Grandpass
byline: An individual has been arrested in the Grandpass area for possession of 510 grams and 440 milligrams of the narcotic substance Crystal Methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’).

title: Public warned of fraudsters posing as police officers to defraud citizens
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID), through its Computer Crime Investigation Division (CCID), has initiated investigations into multiple complaints concerning a group of individuals fraudulently obtaining money from the public while posing as police officers, according to the Police Media Division.

title: Namal Rajapaksa responds to cancellation of Oxford and Cambridge Union events
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has responded to the cancellation of his planned speaking engagements at the Oxford Union and Cambridge Union, following backlash from Tamil student groups and campaigners in the United Kingdom.

title: Youth arrested in connection with Rs. 620,000 theft from Russian tourist in Unawatuna
byline: The daughter of a hotel owner in Pilagoda, Unawatuna, has been arrested in connection with the theft of Rs. 620,000 from a Russian tourist staying at the hotel.

title: 10 arrested for illegal harvesting of sea cucumbers
byline: A total of 10 individuals have been arrested with illegally harvested sea cucumbers in Iranativu, Kilinochchi, the Sri Lanka Navy stated.

title: O/L candidate hospitalized after alleged assault by father sits exam with police assistance
byline: An Ordinary Level (O/L) examination candidate who was hospitalized following an alleged assault by her father sat for the Mathematics paper today (23) with the assistance of the Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of Aluthgama Police.

title: Over 950 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 958 individuals were arrested yesterday (22) during raids conducted under the “Nation United – National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country, police said.

title: Two critically injured in accident involving car and motorcycle
byline: Two women have sustained serious injuries in an accident involving a motorcycle and a car along the Hingurakgoda–Polonnaruwa main road in Hathamuna, this morning (23), police stated.

title: Indian Embassy urges nationals to leave Iran amid protests
byline: The Embassy of India in Iran on Monday issued an advisory asking Indian nationals to leave Iran through available means of transport, including commercial flights, in view of the evolving situation and ongoing nationwide anti-government protests.

title: 19 killed in bus crash in Nepal
byline: A 24-year-old British man is among 19 people who were killed in a bus crash in Nepal, police say.

title: Amarakeerthi Athukorala Murder Case: Relatives of those found guilty to appeal against verdict
byline: The relatives of those found guilty in the murder case of late Polonnaruwa District Member of Parliament Amarakeerthi Athukorala and his security officer have stated that they will file an appeal challenging the recent verdict delivered by the Gampaha High Court trial-at-bar.

title: Four arrested in Hikkaduwa over assault on prison officer and series of thefts
byline: Four individuals have been arrested in connection with a series of thefts, including the brutal assault of a prison officer using a sharp weapon and the theft of a motorcycle in the Hikkaduwa area.

title: Sajith urges govt to absorb underemployed and archaeology graduates to teaching service
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa has requested that underemployed graduates and archaeology graduates be granted the opportunity to enter the teaching service.

title: Oxford Union cancels Namal Rajapaksa event after backlash
byline: The Oxford Union has cancelled a planned speaking event with Sri Lankan MP Namal Rajapaksa following backlash from Tamil student groups and campaigners. The Cambridge Union cancelled Rajapaksa’s scheduled visit several days ago.

title: Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda confirm their wedding
byline: Popular Indian actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda have officially confirmed their wedding, making their long-speculated relationship public after nearly eight years.

title: Sri Lanka’s inflation dips to 2.4% in January 2026
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the National Consumer Price Index (NCPI), has decreased to 2.4% in January 2026, compared to 2.9% in December 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Academics, activists express concern after FCID summons Prof. Maithree Wickremesinghe
byline: A coalition of academics, journalists, feminist activists, and lawyers has issued a statement expressing concern over reports that former First Lady Professor Maithree Wickremesinghe has been summoned by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) of the Criminal Investigation Department (CID).

title: Taiwan rattled by 5.6 magnitude quake, no reports of damage
byline: A 5.6 magnitude earthquake struck just off the coast of Taiwan’s northeastern county of Yilan on Tuesday, the island’s weather administration said, with no reports of damage.

title: Vehicular movement remains suspended on Somawathiya–Sungavila road
byline: Vehicular movement along the Somawathiya–Sungavila main road continues to be suspended following flooding caused by the overflow of the Mahaweli River.

title: Three injured after car topples down precipice in Norton Bridge
byline: A motor car carrying a group while returning to Avissawella after visiting Sri Pada (Adam’s Peak) has veered off the road and toppled nearly 100 feet down a precipice.

title: Fisherman arrested for illegal fishing with tractor-mounted winches in Maggona
byline: A fisherman who was engaged in illegal seine net (Madel) fishing using winches has been arrested yesterday (23) along with two tractors mounted with winches.

title: Portugal’s Foreign Minister arrives in Sri Lanka for two-day visit
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, Paulo Rangel, has arrived in Sri Lanka this morning (24) for a two-day official visit.

title: Traffic disruptions expected due to railway crossing repairs on Kelani Valley Line
byline: Sri Lanka Railways has announced that the railway crossing on the High-Level Road near Kiriwandala Station (Mile 35, Chain 30), between Puwakpitiya and Avissawella on the Kelani Valley Railway Line, will be temporarily closed to facilitate essential repair work.

title: Russia investigating Telegram founder Durov as part of criminal case: Report
byline: Russia is investigating Telegram founder Pavel Durov as part of a criminal case on the “facilitation of terrorist activities”, state-run newspaper Rossiyskaya Gazeta reported, citing the Federal Security Service (FSB).

title: 12 Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy has seized one Indian fishing boat and apprehended 12 Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters, in the sea area south of Mannar.

title: Baby boy born from dead donor womb transplant in UK first
byline: A baby boy has become the first child in Britain to be born to a mother with a womb transplanted from a deceased donor.

title: Bus driver dies following head-on collision in Moronthuduwa
byline: One of the bus drivers involved in the head-on collision of two private buses on Moronthuduwa Road in Wadduwa this morning (24), has succumbed to his injuries.

title: Trump’s new tariffs shift focus to balance of payments; economists see no crisis
byline: President Donald Trump’s temporary 15% tariffs to replace those struck down by the U.S. Supreme Court are meant to resolve a problem that many economists say does not exist: a U.S. balance of payments crisis, making them potentially vulnerable to new legal challenges.

title: Woman arrested for defrauding Rs. 16 mln by promising jobs in Romania
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) says that a woman who had allegedly defrauded nearly Rs. 16 million by promising overseas employment opportunities in Romania has been arrested.

title: Showers predicted for some parts of the island
byline: Showers or thundershowers are likely at a few places in the Southern Province and in the Ratnapura, Monaragala and Kalutara districts today (24), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 400,000 permanent driving licences issued to temporary holders
byline: A total of 400,000 permanent driving licences have been issued so far to drivers who were previously given temporary licences, the Department of Motor Traffic stated.

title: 44 wild elephant deaths reported in 2026
byline: A total of 44 wild elephant deaths have been recorded so far this year, according to the Department of Wildlife Conservation.

title: Newlywed couple killed in motorcycle-bus collision in Dambulla
byline: A newlywed couple who was married just three months ago has died in a tragic accident in Yapagama, Dambulla, police stated.

title: CEB restructuring delayed
byline: Reports indicate that the National Electricity Policy has not yet been presented to the Cabinet of Ministers.

title: Gunmen kill five police officers in northwest Pakistan near Afghan border
byline: Gunmen ambushed a police vehicle and killed five officials in northwest Pakistan on Tuesday, police said, as the South Asian nation struggles to quell a rising wave of militant attacks and faces renewed border tensions with neighbouring Afghanistan.

title: Contract killer arrested over alleged plot to kill police informant and leave severed head at ASP Olugala’s residence
byline: Police have arrested a suspected contract killer who had allegedly accepted a contract to assassinate a police informant—who provided the tip-off for a large-scale narcotics seizure—and to place the victim’s severed head in front of the residence of ASP Rohan Olugala, who led that investigation.

title: 80% of Akuregoda double murder investigation completed – Police
byline: Around 80% of investigations into the incident in which a lawyer and his wife were shot and killed at a supermarket parking area in Akuregoda have been completed, police stated.

title: Committee appointed to examine coal import quality discrepancies
byline: A committee of experts has been appointed by the Ministry of Energy to study issues related to coal imports, Cabinet spokesperson Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Approval granted for new Ambassadors to Ethiopia and Iran
byline: The Committee on High Posts of Parliament has approved the nominations of two Heads of Mission and a Ministry Secretary.

title: Family alleges negligence by hospital doctors after 22-year-old dies from dengue
byline: A 22-year-old woman has passed away after being transferred from the Minuwangoda Base Hospital to the Gampaha District General Hospital, with her family alleging negligence by hospital authorities.

title: Kerala to become ‘Keralam’: Indian Cabinet approves change of name
byline: The Union Cabinet on Tuesday (24) approved the renaming of the State of “Kerala” to “Keralam”, Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced. On June 24, 2024, the Kerala Assembly had unanimously passed a resolution urging the Union government to rename the State as “Keralam”.

title: Proposed 13.56% CEB tariff hike: PUCSL seeks public views
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) will hold public consultation sessions until March 18 on the proposal submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to revise electricity tariffs for the second quarter of 2026.

title: Three new Ambassadors present credentials to President
byline: Three newly appointed Ambassadors-designate presented their Letters of Credence to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, at the Presidential Secretariat today (24).

title: Rs. 24 billion released to those affected by Cyclone Ditwah: Officials
byline: Approximately Rs. 24.4 billion have been released under various relief schemes announced for those affected by Cyclone Ditwah, officials have informed the Committee on Public Finance.

title: March 1–7 declared as National Drug Prevention week
byline: The government has declared the week commencing March 1, 2026, as the Drug Prevention Week, in a significant move to combat the narcotics crisis.

title: SC seeks Govt’s stance on State of Emergency and social media ban during ‘Aragalaya’
byline: The Supreme Court has granted time to the Attorney General to inform the stance of the current President and the government regarding fundamental rights petitions filed against a group that includes former President Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

title: Sri Lankan researcher Duleeka Sandamali Gunarathne among 2026 OWSD-Elsevier Foundation Awards winners
byline: Sri Lankan researcher Duleeka Sandamali Gunarathne and four other researchers have been awarded the 2026 OWSD-Elsevier Foundation Awards for Early-Career Women Scientists from the global South.

title: Seven-member committee named to review coal supply mechanism for Lakvijaya Power Plant
byline: A seven-member committee has been appointed to evaluate the current coal supply mechanism to the Lakvijaya Power Plant, the Ministry of Energy announced in a statement.

title: Australian PM evacuated from his house due to safety threat
byline: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has been evacuated from his official residence due to a safety threat.

title: Donald Trump’s new tariff comes into effect at lower than expected rate
byline: US President Donald Trump’s new global tariffs have come into effect at 10% despite a pledge to introduce them at a higher rate.

title: 140kg of cannabis seized in Haldummulla
byline: A large consignment of cannabis valued at approximately Rs. 14 million has been seized in the Ilukpelsa Reserve Haldummulla.

title: Ex-Police Inspector arrested over 2023 Weligama hotel shooting remanded
byline: Former Inspector of Police (IP) Jagath Nishantha, who was arrested over the 2023 shooting incident near the W15 Hotel in Weligama has been remanded.

title: Second gunman in Akuregoda double murder arrested by police
byline: The second gunman involved in the recent shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda has been arrested by police.
